intro: Austrosteenisia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants typically have basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves and produce showy, yellow to orange composite flower heads. Austrosteenisia species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their vibrant blooms.
